name: ～上がる
explanation:
A verb that is used at the end of stem verbs to emphasize the completion or increase of an action.
It is commonly used when an effect or product is produced as a result of the verb it is attached to.
conjugation: 動詞「連用形」＋あがる

sentences.jp: レポートは書き上げた？
sentences.eg: Did you finish writing the paper?

sentences.jp: 古いコンピューターは立ち上がるのに十分かかる。
sentences.eg: It takes an old computer 10 minutes to finish booting.

sentences.jp: 空は雨の後で腫れ上がった。
sentences.eg: The weather cleared completely after the rain.

sentences.jp: 商品の価格が急に値上がりしました。
sentences.eg: The price of commodities suddenly rose.

name: ～がかり
explanation: A suffix used with nouns to emphasize the time or effort spent on an action or task.

sentences.jp: この作業は五人がかりでやっと終わりました。
sentences.eg: This task was finally finished with the help of five people.

sentences.jp: この研究は一年がかりの努力の結果です。
sentences.eg: This research is the result of a year’s effort.

sentences.jp: このロボットの修理は数日がかりで完了しました。
sentences.eg: The repair of this robot took several days.

sentences.jp: この農作物の収穫は二ヶ月がかりで行いました。
sentences.eg: The harvest of these crops took two months.

name: ～がたい
explanation:
A suffix used at the end of stem verbs to indicate that an action is difficult or nearly impossible.
It emphasizes the psychological difficulty or moral impossibility of performing the action.
As such it has a stronger meaning compared to にくい.
conjugation: 動詞「連用形」＋がたい

sentences.jp: 彼の話は信じがたいです。
sentences.eg: His story is hard to believe.

sentences.jp: 自分の夢が終わるのは受け入れがたいんだな。
sentences.eg: It’s hard to accept that my dream is dead.

sentences.jp: あの罪は許しがたい。
あの先生は偉すぎて、近寄りがたいね。
sentences.eg: That professor is so respected that I can hardly approach him.

name: きる・きれる・きれない
explanation:
An auxiliary verb used to indicate the completion or thoroughness of an action.
It emphasizes the ability to fully complete something.
conjugation: 動詞「連用形」＋きる・きれる・きれない

sentences.jp: 今日はライトノベルを二冊も読み切った。
sentences.eg: I finished reading 2 light novels today.

sentences.jp: 自分は全部使い切るまで、新しいのを買わない。
sentences.eg: Personally, I don’t buy new ones until I use everything up.

sentences.jp: この商品はすぐに売り切れます。
こんなにたくさんの料理は食べきれませんよ。
sentences.eg: I can’t finish eating this much food.
